segment.source: The topics in this section provide information for installing an enhanced security version of the App-V Management Server or the App-V Streaming Server.
segment.target: The topics in this section provide information for installing an enhanced security version of the App-V Management Server or the App-V Streaming Server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Installing or configuring an App-V Management or Streaming Server to use enhanced security (for example, Transport Layer Security, or TLS) requires that an X.509 V3 certificate has been provisioned to the App-V server.
segment.target: Installing or configuring an App-V Management or Streaming Server to use enhanced security (for example, Transport Layer Security, or TLS) requires that an X.509 V3 certificate has been provisioned to the App-V server.

segment.source: When you prepare to install or configure a secure Management or Streaming Server, consider the following technical requirements:
segment.target: When you prepare to install or configure a secure Management or Streaming Server, consider the following technical requirements:

segment.source: The certificate must be valid.
segment.target: The certificate must be valid.

segment.source: If the certificate is not valid, the client ends the connection.
segment.target: If the certificate is not valid, the client ends the connection.

segment.source: The certificate must contain the correct Enhanced Key Usage (EKU)—Server Authentication (OID 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1).
segment.target: The certificate must contain the correct Enhanced Key Usage (EKU)—Server Authentication (OID 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1).

segment.source: If the certificate does not contain this EKU, the client ends the connection.
segment.target: If the certificate does not contain this EKU, the client ends the connection.

segment.source: The certificate fully qualified domain name (FQDN) must match the server on which it is installed.
segment.target: The certificate fully qualified domain name (FQDN) must match the server on which it is installed.

segment.source: For example, if the client is calling and the certificate Issued To field is set to , the client will not connect to the server and the session ends.
segment.target: For example, if the client is calling and the certificate Issued To field is set to , the client will not connect to the server and the session ends.

segment.source: The failure is reported to the user.
segment.target: The failure is reported to the user.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are using App-V in a Network Load Balancing cluster, you must configure the certificate with Subject Alternate Names (SANs) to support RTSPS.
segment.target: If you are using App-V in a Network Load Balancing cluster, you must configure the certificate with Subject Alternate Names (SANs) to support RTSPS.

segment.source: For information about configuring the certification authority (CA) and creating certificates with SANs, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=133228.
segment.target: For information about configuring the certification authority (CA) and creating certificates with SANs, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=133228.

segment.source: The client and the server need to trust the root CA—The CA issuing the certificate to the App-V server must by trusted by the client connecting to the server.
segment.target: The client and the server need to trust the root CA—The CA issuing the certificate to the App-V server must by trusted by the client connecting to the server.

segment.source: If not, the client ends the connection.
segment.target: If not, the client ends the connection.

segment.source: The certificate’s private key must have permissions changed to allow the App-V Service account to access the certificate.
segment.target: The certificate’s private key must have permissions changed to allow the App-V Service account to access the certificate.

segment.source: By default, App-V uses the Network Service account, and by default, the Network Service account does not have permission to access the private key, which will prevent secure connections.
segment.target: By default, App-V uses the Network Service account, and by default, the Network Service account does not have permission to access the private key, which will prevent secure connections.
